result.execSummary:
The defendant Rusty A. Ray was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Rusty A. Ray
Current: 316 E Slocumb St, Rice Lake, WI 54868 United States  (Effective: 09-23-2022)
Prior: 658 S Main St, Chippewa Falls, WI 54729
Letter sent to defendant regarding DOC to COC Collects.
AMENDED - Restitution now $0 (concurrent case) - Clerk of Courts to Collect.

4:05 PM cases 20CF569, 20CF966, 20CM19, 20CM330, 22CF87 called and held via Zoom. Prosecuting attorney Peter J. Rindal appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Rusty A. Ray appeared by video, Attorney Robert Allen Thorson appeared in court for Rusty A. Ray. Branch 1 to hear Branch 4 case pleas with the approval of Branch 4 and willingness of Branch 1 to do so. Defendant waives right to appear in person and Court accepts waiver.  Defense recites joint agreement.  In 22CF87 and 20CF569: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
In 20CM330: Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to counts 1 and 4 of the criminal complaint. 
In20CM19: Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 1 of the criminal complaint. 
In 20CF569: Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to counts 1 and 3 of the Information. 
In 20CF966: Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 1 of the Information. 
In 22CF87: Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 1 of the Information. 
Court accepts all pleas and finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
State makes a statement before sentencing. Defense makes a statement before sentencing. Defendant asks for a No Contact order against T.L.R. 
As to the counts to which the defendant pled in 20CM330, 20CM19, and count 3 in 20CF569: Court orders court costs including the DNA sample surcharge and one bench warrant fee in 20CM19. 
As to the counts to which the defendant pled in 22CF87, 20CF966, and Count 1 in 20CF569: Court withholds sentencing and places the defendant on Probation for 3 years with conditions: 
No Contact with Casa Mexicana in Rice Lake, WI . No Contact with H.L., her child, or her residence without the Probation Officer and H.L.'s approval. No Contact with T.L.R. 
Defendant is not to have possession or use of any weapons including firearms. Defendant to pay restitution (amount to be determined within 60 days) and applicable surcharges. 
Defendant to complete AODA, a Domestic Abuse Assessment, and Anger Management assessment and follow through with any recommendations. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations. 
Defendant to pay court costs on all counts including any applicable surcharges. Any weapons seized are to be forfeited. 
As to Count 1 in 20CF569: 180 days in Jail with Huber all Stayed pending further order of the Court. 
Parties to stipulate to sentence credit and submit for the Court to sign.
See plea hearing docket for details as to the waiver.

(11:24 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Rusty A. Ray appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by phone for Rusty A. Ray. 
Defendant acknowledges receipt of the complaint.
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
State requests $7,500.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Defendant makes argument for signature bond.
Court orders $7,500.00 cash bond with conditions.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on February 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Conditions:
No contact with H.L., Casa Mexicana in Rice Lake. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
No use or possession of weapons to include firearms.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
